title: 114_hr7
content: The Act titled "No Taxpayer Funding for Abortion and Abortion Insurance Full Disclosure Act of 2015" prohibits taxpayer-funded abortions and clarifies the application of this prohibition to premium credits and cost-sharing reductions under the Affordable Care Act. SEC. 101. PROHIBITING TAXPAYER FUNDED ABORTIONS. Title 1, United States Code is amended by adding a new chapter titled "PROHIBITING TAXPAYER FUNDED ABORTIONS." Sec. 301 prohibits federal funding for abortions. Sec. 302 prohibits funding for health plans covering abortion. Sec. 303 limits federal facilities and employees. Sec. 304 relates to separate coverage. Sec. 305 concerns the use of non-Federal funds for health coverage. Sec. 306 does not preempt other federal laws. Sec. 307 addresses complications from abortion. Sec. 308 covers abortions related to rape, incest, or preserving the mother's life. Sec. 309 applies to the District of Columbia. Sec. 302 prohibits federal funding for health plans covering abortion and limits abortion services in federal facilities and by federal employees. Sec. 304 clarifies that individuals, entities, or states can still purchase separate coverage for abortion. Sec. 305 allows individuals, entities, or states to purchase abortion coverage using non-Federal funds without restrictions, as long as no matching funds from federally subsidized programs are used. Sec. 306 states that the chapter does not affect other Federal laws limiting funds for abortion coverage. Sec. 307 clarifies that the chapter does not apply to treating complications from abortions, regardless of legality. Abortion performed in accordance with Federal or State law, regardless of funding. Exceptions for abortions related to rape, incest, or preserving the life of the mother due to physical danger certified by a physician. Application to District of Columbia. In this chapter, any funds appropriated by Federal law include amounts approved by Act of Congress for the District of Columbia. The term 'Federal Government' encompasses the government of the District of Columbia. SEC. 102 amends the table of chapters for title 1, United States Code, by adding a new item prohibiting taxpayer-funded abortions. Under TITLE II, SEC. 201 clarifies the application of the prohibition to premium credits and cost-sharing reductions under the Affordable Care Act. SEC. 102 amends the table of chapters for title 1, United States Code, by adding a new item prohibiting taxpayer-funded abortions. Under TITLE II, SEC. 201 clarifies the application of the prohibition to premium credits and cost-sharing reductions under the Affordable Care Act. In General, disallows refundable credit and cost-sharing reductions for coverage under a qualified health plan that includes coverage for abortions, with an option to purchase or offer separate abortion coverage or plan. Option to purchase separate coverage for abortions described in subparagraph (A) or a health plan that includes such abortions is allowed, as long as no credit is allowed under this section for the premiums of such coverage or plan. Non-Federal health insurance issuers can also offer separate coverage for abortions. The health plan can offer separate coverage for abortions, but no credit is allowed for premiums paid with the credit under this section. Small employer health insurance expense credit is disallowed for plans including abortion coverage. The term 'qualified health plan' excludes any plan with abortion coverage, but employers can purchase separate coverage for abortions. No credit is allowed for premiums paid with the small employer health insurance expense credit. The provision allows non-Federal health insurance issuers to offer separate coverage for abortions in health plans, as long as no employer contributions eligible for tax credits are used to pay for it. The provision allows non-Federal health insurance issuers to offer separate coverage for abortions in health plans, ensuring that no Federal funds are used for such coverage. The amendments to the United States Code apply to taxable years ending after December 31, 2015, and plan years beginning after that date. SEC. 202. Revision of notice requirements for disclosure of health plan coverage of abortion and abortion premium surcharges. SEC. 202 amends section 1303(b) of Public Law 111-148 regarding disclosure of coverage for services in qualified health plans. Coverage details must be disclosed at enrollment and prominently displayed in marketing materials, comparison tools, and summaries of benefits. The amendment requires separate disclosure of abortion surcharges in qualified health plans that include such services. This disclosure must be made in marketing materials and other information, effective more than 30 days after the enactment of the Act. The House of Representatives passed the bill on January 22, 2015.
